sites.title: Camron-Stanford House
sites.summary: An example Victorian home on Lake Merritt showcasing 19th-century domestic architecture.
sites.description_md:
# Camron-Stanford House

The Camron-Stanford House is a beautifully preserved Victorian mansion that serves as a window into Oakland's 19th-century past. Built in 1876, this Italianate villa was once the home of several prominent Oakland families.

## Historical Significance

The house represents the height of Victorian domestic architecture in Oakland and has been carefully restored to reflect different periods of its occupation. Today it operates as a house museum, offering visitors a glimpse into the lifestyle of Oakland's early elite families.

## Architecture

The building features classic Italianate elements including:
- Bay windows
- Decorative brackets
- Classical pediments
- Period-appropriate interior furnishings

sites.title: Fox Oakland Theatre
sites.summary: Historic movie palace and concert venue showcasing 1920s atmospheric theater design.
sites.description_md:
# Fox Oakland Theatre

Built in 1928, the Fox Oakland Theatre is a stunning example of the atmospheric theater style popular during the golden age of cinema. The theater was designed to transport audiences to an exotic outdoor setting with its elaborate ceiling that mimics a starry night sky.

## Restoration

After decades of decline, the theater underwent a major restoration in the 2000s and now serves as a premier concert venue while maintaining its historic character.

sites.title: Oakland Museum of California
sites.summary: Modernist museum complex showcasing California's art, history, and natural sciences.
sites.description_md:
# Oakland Museum of California

Designed by Kevin Roche and opened in 1969, the Oakland Museum of California is renowned for both its innovative architecture and comprehensive collection focusing on California's diverse heritage.

## Architectural Innovation

The museum's terraced design integrates gardens and galleries, creating a unique indoor-outdoor experience that reflects California's lifestyle and climate.

sites.title: Pardee Home Museum
sites.summary: Historic Victorian home of California Governor George Pardee, preserved as a house museum.
sites.description_md:
# Pardee Home Museum

This Italianate Victorian mansion was built in 1868 and served as the home of George Pardee, who served as California's governor from 1903 to 1907. The house remains remarkably intact with original furnishings and family artifacts.

sites.title: Oakland City Hall
sites.address: 1 Frank H Ogawa Plaza, Oakland, CA 94612
sites.summary: Beaux-Arts style city hall building serving as Oakland's seat of government since 1914.
sites.description_md:
# Oakland City Hall

Completed in 1914, Oakland City Hall is a prime example of Beaux-Arts architecture and has served as the center of Oakland's municipal government for over a century. The building features a distinctive clock tower and classical facade.

sites.title: Dunsmuir Hellman Historic Estate
sites.summary: Gilded Age mansion and gardens showcasing turn-of-the-century luxury living.
sites.description_md:
# Dunsmuir Hellman Historic Estate

Built in 1899, this Colonial Revival mansion was the country estate of Alexander Dunsmuir, a Canadian coal baron. The 50-room mansion sits on 40 acres and features elaborate gardens and period furnishings.

sites.title: Mountain View Cemetery
sites.summary: Historic garden cemetery designed by Frederick Law Olmsted with panoramic Bay Area views.
sites.description_md:
# Mountain View Cemetery

Established in 1863 and designed by Frederick Law Olmsted (co-designer of Central Park), Mountain View Cemetery is both a burial ground and a work of landscape art. The cemetery offers stunning views of the San Francisco Bay.

sites.title: First Unitarian Church
sites.summary: Historic Romanesque Revival church with significant architectural and social history.
sites.description_md:
# First Unitarian Church of Oakland

Built in 1891, this Romanesque Revival church has been a center of progressive religious and social activism in Oakland for over 130 years. The building features beautiful stained glass and carved woodwork.

sites.title: Lake Merritt
sites.summary: Historic tidal lagoon designated as the first National Wildlife Refuge in the United States.
sites.description_md:
# Lake Merritt

Lake Merritt was designated in 1870 as the first National Wildlife Refuge in the United States. This tidal lagoon in the heart of Oakland has been a center of recreation and wildlife conservation for over 150 years.

sites.title: Oakland Army Base
sites.summary: Former military installation that served as a major Pacific Theater logistics hub during WWII.
sites.description_md:
# Oakland Army Base

Established in 1941, the Oakland Army Base served as a critical logistics and shipping point for the Pacific Theater during World War II. The base was decommissioned in 1999 and portions have been redeveloped for civilian use.
